page.title: 08EDUCATION IN BEWCASTLE
page.content: Within the survey zone there now exists only a primary school, which serves the whole of the area and the surrounding parish.Formerly there was another school about a mile away to the north-east but it is now ruined. State education in the area starts at the age of three when the children can go on the nursery-bus , a converted mini-bus which goes round to farms picking up young children and either taking them into school or providing a session actually in the bus.At four the children move into the primary school full-time , being brought there each day by a carefully organised system of taxis. At present there are 42 children in the school in two classes.When aged eleven the children move to Longtown School, again being transported there by special bus.
